result.execSummary:
The defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin.
Pay all costs, fees and assessments including DV and DNA. Bail on deposit to apply.  Any remaining bail to be returned to the person who posted it.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

No contact with victim.
No contact with firearms.

Mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatement.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised due to felony conviction the deendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zhahir Nadir Mustafa

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Court proceeded to sentencing.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 and 1/2 YEARS, the maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 and 1/2 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence with the following conditions:

- Mental health assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
- No contact with victim.
- Parenting classes.
- Cognitive Intervention Program.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments including DV and DNA.  Bail on deposit to apply.  Any remainin bail to be returned to the person who posted it.

*The defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court advised Defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, AND ADDENDUM

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in court, appear by video with attorney Jason Canfield, appear by video.  Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Jason Canfield is unavailable for todays hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appearing on behalf of the SPD.  Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in custody. Gerald Henry Alder on behalf of Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for hearing. Attorney Sargent appeared off the record and advised there is a conflict with SPD appointment. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court finds good cause to adjourn preliminary hearing time limits. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa not in court, defendant in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney R. Webb represents the defendant in 21CF3675 & 21CF4189, but has not been retained in this matter. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KDC (03/01/2000) and her child

Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Zhahir Nadir Mustafa in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zhahir Nadir Mustafa appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
